document_data.name: Sons of Gondegal
document_data.symbol: Gray wolf's head with red eyes
document_data.mainbody: The '''Sons of Gondegal''' were a gang of brigands operating in [[Cormyr]] in the late 1370s [[DR]].{{Cite dungeon/198/Cormyr Royale: The Royal Court of the Forest Kingdom|51}}
document_data.Description: They named themselves for [[Gondegal]], the Lost King, who led an uprising in Cormyr and briefly seized the city of [[Arabel]] in the {{YearlinkName|1352}}. They even carried his standard: a gray [[wolf]]'s head with red eyes. It's unknown what connection they had to their namesake.
document_data.History:
In the late 1370s DR, the Sons of Gondegal started threatening caravans and farms between Arabel and the [[Shadow Gap]]. They'd escaped capture by [[1379 DR]], but Warden [[Dauneth Marliir]] promised their heads to Steel Regent [[Alusair Obarskyr]] before long.

But they had ambitious plans to infiltrate the [[King's Forest]] and from there conquer Arabel.{{Cite dungeon/198/Cormyr Royale: The Royal Court of the Forest Kingdom|48}}
